title: Welcome!
text:
Hello, I’m Daniel!



I am a student at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), interested in data, technology, and applied learning.
This website showcases some of my past projects, a data visualization example, and my reflection on using GenAI tools.

Final Year Project (or other project) overview.
One data visualization project from my student life.
Reflection on how GenAI supported the development of this webpage.

title: FYP Project
text:
Project Overview
I am a Temasek Polytechnic alumni and my Final Year Project explored ways to improve inventory management and overall supply chain efficiency.
We wanted to reduce delays, avoid stockouts, and make daily operations smoother for businesses.

Focus: Practical ideas to improve inventory workflows and tracking.
Time period: Aug 2022 – Mar 2023
Team: Group of 4



Methodology (how we did it)

Data collection and research
We studied existing supply chain practices and gathered information from reports, sites, and interviews to understand common problems.
Challenges of implementing solutions
We had to balance cost, staff training, and how easily new ideas could fit into existing systems.
Template showcase room
We built a small “showcase room” concept to demonstrate how our proposed solutions could look and work in a real setting, using layouts and simple visuals.

title: Data Visualization
text: You can view the full code for this visualization on my GitHub repository.

title: Data Visualization
text:
This page presents one quantitative data visualization I created during my studies.


You can view the full code for this visualization on my GitHub repository.





The top panel tracks my total number of trades, realised profit and loss, and win rate over the semester.
The line charts show daily price movements and indicators for different stocks.
The bottom panel visualizes my buy and sell points, which helped me reflect on my trading decisions.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: For this website, I used GenAI tools such as Perplexity to guide me through the Quarto setup and to fix issues with the navbar, YAML, and images. They helped me find the right syntax more quickly and suggested clearer ways to structure each page.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: For this website, I used GenAI tools such as Perplexity to guide me through the Quarto setup and to fix issues with the navbar, YAML, and images. They helped me find the right syntax more quickly and suggested clearer ways to structure each page.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
What helped me
The main benefit was saving time. Instead of reading long documentation, I could ask specific questions and get targeted answers, then adapt them to my own project. This also helped me spot mistakes I might have missed on my own.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
What I learned
At the same time, I realised I still had to understand what I was doing. When something did not work, I had to check the code, compare it with my files, and make my own decisions. Going forward, I expect to use GenAI in a similar way: as a quick helper for ideas and troubleshooting, while I remain responsible for the final work and my own understanding.
